intro: Patagonium cuneatum, commonly known as the Patagonian wedgeleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Patagonium cuneatum is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of alpine ecosystems.
